Generation II.Gold: It traps enemies with its suction-cupped tentacles then smashes them with its rock-hard head.
Generation II.Silver: It instinctively sneaks into rocky holes. If it gets sleepy, it steals the nest of a fellow Octillery .
Generation II.Crystal: Its instinct is to bury itself in holes. It often steals the nesting holes of others to sleep in them.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It traps enemies with its suction cupped tentacles then smashes them with its rock-hard head. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It instinctively sneaks into rocky holes. If it gets sleepy, it steals the nest of a fellow Octillery . (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Octillery grabs onto its foe using its tentacles. This Pok é mon tries to immobilize it before delivering the finishing blow. If the foe turns out to be too strong, Octillery spews ink to escape.
Generation III.Sapphire: Octillery grabs onto its foe using its tentacles. This Pok é mon tries to immobilize it before delivering the finishing blow. If the foe turns out to be too strong, Octillery spews ink to escape.
Generation III.Emerald: It ensnares its foe with its suction-cupped tentacles before delivering the finishing blow. If the foe turns out to be too strong, it spews ink to escape.
Generation III.FireRed: It instinctively sneaks into rocky holes. If it gets sleepy, it steals the nest of a fellow Octillery .
Generation III.LeafGreen: It traps enemies with its suction-cupped tentacles, then smashes them with its rock-hard head.

Generation IV.Diamond: It lives in the gaps of boulders and in holes on the seafloor. Its suction cups grip prey tightly.
Generation IV.Pearl: It obscures its foe's vision by spitting a cloud of murky ink. It makes its nest among boulders.
Generation IV.Platinum: It loves to lurk inside holes in rocks. It sometimes sprays ink on prey by sticking out only its mouth.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It traps foes with the suction cups on its tentacles, then smashes them with its rock-hard head.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It instinctively sneaks into rocky holes. If it gets sleepy, it steals the nest of a fellow Octillery .

Generation V.Black: It loves to lurk inside holes in rocks. It sometimes sprays ink on prey by sticking out only its mouth.
Generation V.White: It loves to lurk inside holes in rocks. It sometimes sprays ink on prey by sticking out only its mouth.
Generation V.Black 2: It has a tendency to want to be in holes. It prefers rock crags or pots and sprays ink from them before attacking.
Generation V.White 2: It has a tendency to want to be in holes. It prefers rock crags or pots and sprays ink from them before attacking.

Generation VI.X: It has a tendency to want to be in holes. It prefers rock crags or pots and sprays ink from them before attacking.
Generation VI.Y: It traps foes with the suction cups on its tentacles, then smashes them with its rock-hard head.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Octillery grabs onto its foe using its tentacles. This Pokémon tries to immobilize it before delivering the finishing blow. If the foe turns out to be too strong, Octillery spews ink to escape.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Octillery grabs onto its foe using its tentacles. This Pokémon tries to immobilize it before delivering the finishing blow. If the foe turns out to be too strong, Octillery spews ink to escape.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: The ink it spits when escaping is special. It contains a substance that dulls the sense of smell, so Pokémon with keen noses get lost.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It usually sleeps in caves. The pitch-black ink that Octillery spits is also used for cooking.

Generation VIII.Sword: It has a tendency to want to be in holes. It prefers rock crags or pots and sprays ink from them before attacking.
Generation VIII.Shield: It traps enemies with its suction-cupped tentacles, then smashes them with its rock-hard head.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It lives in the gaps of boulders and in holes on the seafloor. Its suction cups grip prey tightly.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It obscures its foe's vision by spitting a cloud of black ink. It makes its nest among boulders.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: While Octillery still shoots water from its mouth, the drastic anatomical difference between it and Remoraid meant that for a long time, no one believed the former evolved from the latter.
